docs.snippet: The UN human rights chief on Tuesday called on Bahrain's government to immediately release the leader of the country's main Shiite opposition group and the European Union warned that his arrest could further destabilize an already fragile politica...

headline.main: UN, EU Concerned at Arrest of Top Bahrain Shiite Leader
headline.print_headline: UN, EU Concerned at Arrest of Top Bahrain Shiite Leader

docs.lead_paragraph: The UN human rights chief on Tuesday called on Bahrain's government to immediately release the leader of the country's main Shiite opposition group and the European Union warned that his arrest could further destabilize an already fragile political environment.

docs.snippet: In a story Dec. 30 about the auction of a Ku Klux Klan robe, The Associated Press, relying on information provided by the auctioneer, erroneously reported the winning bid. The robe sold for $375, not $350....
docs.lead_paragraph: In a story Dec. 30 about the auction of a Ku Klux Klan robe, The Associated Press, relying on information provided by the auctioneer, erroneously reported the winning bid. The robe sold for $375, not $350.

docs.snippet: Michael Greller, who left his job as a math teacher to caddie for Jordan Spieth, has often said dealing with 30 sixth-graders for 10 years helped prepare him to work for a 21-year-old golfer who ended the year at No. 9 in the world....

headline.main: Caddie Reminded of Great Australian Adventure
headline.print_headline: Caddie Reminded of Great Australian Adventure

docs.lead_paragraph: Michael Greller, who left his job as a math teacher to caddie for Jordan Spieth, has often said dealing with 30 sixth-graders for 10 years helped prepare him to work for a 21-year-old golfer who ended the year at No. 9 in the world.

docs.snippet: Two Boston police officers were hospitalized after they were allegedly attacked by seven teenagers, all family members, in a Roxbury apartment complex when the officers tried to arrest one of them, authorities said Tuesday....

headline.main: Police: 2 Boston Officers Attacked by Teenagers
headline.print_headline: Police: 2 Boston Officers Attacked by Teenagers

docs.lead_paragraph: Two Boston police officers were hospitalized after they were allegedly attacked by seven teenagers, all family members, in a Roxbury apartment complex when the officers tried to arrest one of them, authorities said Tuesday.

docs.snippet: Nearly 6.5 million people either selected or were enrolled in a new individual insurance plan for 2015 on the HealthCare.gov website through Dec. 26, the U.S. government health agency said on Tuesday....

headline.main: Nearly 6.5 Million People in 2015 HealthCare.gov Plans: U.S. Agency
headline.print_headline: Nearly 6.5 Million People in 2015 HealthCare.gov Plans: U.S. Agency

docs.lead_paragraph: Nearly 6.5 million people either selected or were enrolled in a new individual insurance plan for 2015 on the HealthCare.gov website through Dec. 26, the U.S. government health agency said on Tuesday.

docs.snippet: Iran and six world powers are set to resume low-level talks on Iran's nuclear program in Geneva on Jan 15, with wide gaps remaining in their positions, the Iranian foreign minister said....

headline.main: Iran Says Nuclear Talks Set for Jan 15, Vows to Stand Firm
headline.print_headline: Iran Says Nuclear Talks Set for Jan 15, Vows to Stand Firm

docs.lead_paragraph: Iran and six world powers are set to resume low-level talks on Iran's nuclear program in Geneva on Jan 15, with wide gaps remaining in their positions, the Iranian foreign minister said.

docs.snippet: Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny was detained by police after breaking house arrest on Tuesday to join an opposition rally in Moscow....

headline.main: Police Detain Kremlin Critic Navalny at Rally
headline.print_headline: Police Detain Kremlin Critic Navalny at Rally

docs.lead_paragraph: Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny was detained by police after breaking house arrest on Tuesday to join an opposition rally in Moscow.

docs.snippet: A conservative group on Tuesday sued a county clerk of courts, Orlando's mayor and a judge in an effort to stop them from helping same-sex couples get married in Florida next week....

headline.main: Florida Group Tries to Stop Gay Marriages
headline.print_headline: Florida Group Tries to Stop Gay Marriages

docs.lead_paragraph: A conservative group on Tuesday sued a county clerk of courts, Orlando's mayor and a judge in an effort to stop them from helping same-sex couples get married in Florida next week.

docs.snippet: The United States on Tuesday imposed sanctions on nine new targets, saying the entities and people targeted had supported Iran's efforts to avoid sanctions and backed the government's human rights abuses, including censorship....

headline.main: U.S. Names More Iran Targets for Sanctions
headline.print_headline: U.S. Names More Iran Targets for Sanctions

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States on Tuesday imposed sanctions on nine new targets, saying the entities and people targeted had supported Iran's efforts to avoid sanctions and backed the government's human rights abuses, including censorship.

docs.snippet: Coach Tom Coughlin and general manager Jerry Reese are getting one more chance to turn around the New York Giants — or else....

headline.main: Tom Coughlin, Jerry Reese Returning to Giants
headline.print_headline: Tom Coughlin, Jerry Reese Returning to Giants

docs.lead_paragraph: Coach Tom Coughlin and general manager Jerry Reese are getting one more chance to turn around the New York Giants — or else.
